text: José Concepción Herrera Ontiveros (April 8, 1942 - October 16, 2009) was an outfielder in Major League Baseball who played for the Houston Astros (1967–1968) and Montreal Expos (1969–1970). He batted and threw right-handed. ==Career== Herrera was signed by the Houston Colt .45s as an amateur free agent and made his debut with the team after it became the Astros. In a four- season career, Herrera posted a .264 batting average with two home runs, 20 RBI, 16 runs, 522 hits, and 10 doubles in 80 games played. ==See also== * List of Major League Baseball players from Venezuela ==External links== , or Retrosheet *Mexican League statistics *Venezuelan Professional Baseball League statistics Category:1942 births Category:2009 deaths Category:Amarillo Sonics players Category:Buffalo Bisons (minor league) players Category:Cardenales de Lara players Category:Diablos Rojos del México players Category:Durham Bulls players Category:Evansville Triplets players Category:Houston Astros players Category:Jacksonville Suns players Category:Leones de Yucatán players Category:Llaneros de Portuguesa players Category:Major League Baseball outfielders Category:Major League Baseball players from Venezuela Category:Mexican League baseball players Category:Mineros de Coahuila players Category:Montreal Expos players Category:Oklahoma City 89ers players Category:People from Anzoátegui Category:Portland Beavers players Category:Statesville Colts players Category:Tiburones de La Guaira players Category:Toledo Mud Hens players Category:Vancouver Mounties players Category:Venezuelan expatriate baseball players in Canada Category:Venezuelan expatriate baseball players in Mexico Category:Venezuelan expatriate baseball players in the United States Category:Winnipeg Whips players
title: José Herrera (1960s outfielder)
